oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Broadside featuring the actions of the Tennessee General Assembly relating to the secession of Tennessee from the Union
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This broadside begins with a message from Govenor Isham Harris indicating that Gustavus A. Henry, Archibald O.W. Totten, and Washington Barrow of Tennessee were appointed to confer with the Honorable Henry W. Hillard, Commissioner for the Confederate States of America, regarding the State of Tennessee entering into a military league with the Confederate States. It also includes the act drafted by the Tennessee General Assembly regarding the declaration of independence of Tennessee, or secession of Tennessee from the Union.
Isham Green Harris was governor of Tennessee from 1857 to 1862 when the Union Army captured Nashville. An advocate for secession, Harris raised 100,000 troops in Tennessee for the Confederacy.
